text: 2017 will see a more powerful iMac at the top of the line that rivals and replaces the Mac Pro
full-pick-text: 2017 will see a more powerful iMac at the top of the line that rivals and replaces the Mac Pro. The Mac Pro will go away, the Mac Mini also goes away, by the end of 2017 the iMac is all that remains.
notes:
• "The Mac Pro will go away, the Mac Mini also goes away, by the end of 2017 the iMac is all that remains."
  • While explaining, Myke got a little carried away with how complete this transition would be, but when challenged to make it part of the pick, he decided to go for it.

text: A CPU transition is announced for the Mac
full-pick-text: A CPU transition is announced for the Mac
notes: • Federico counsels against specifying ARM, which is good because Apple calls it "Apple Silicon" and never uses the term ARM.

text: A headset will not be unveiled at WWDC
full-pick-text: A headset will not be unveiled at WWDC

text: A Mac gets a screen that supports touch and/or Apple Pencil input
full-pick-text: A Mac gets a screen that supports touch and/or Apple Pencil input
notes: • Myke was torn between this and "iPad multitasking is overhauled again", but elected to make the more passionate pick.

text: A new Apple Watch has at least one new built-in app because of an exclusive feature not found on existing watches
full-pick-text: A new Apple Watch has at least one new built-in app because of an exclusive feature not found on existing watches

text: A new color of iPhone 13 (family) is announced
full-pick-text: A new color of iPhone 13 (family) is announced

text: A new iPhone Pro colour is Purple
full-pick-text: A new iPhone Pro colour is Purple

text: An Apple Silicon Mac is available to order in November 2020
full-pick-text: An Apple Silicon Mac is available to order in November 2020

text: Any kind of release timeframe is provided for macOS Monterey
full-pick-text: Any kind of release timeframe is provided for macOS Monterey
notes: • Apparently feeling humble, Federico admits that this is a "boring" pick. It was originally "release date", but when some questioning about whether just a month would count came up, he watered it down.

text: Apple announces a developer kit for its headset
full-pick-text: Apple announces a developer kit for its headset

text: Apple announces a Mac mini that is more performant than the original M1 model
full-pick-text: Apple announces a Mac mini that is more performant than the original M1 model
notes: • Stephen returns to the Mac mini, since it served him very well last year.

text: Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower, without designated charging targets
full-pick-text: Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower, without designated charging targets
notes: • Stephen came to the table with two picks: "Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower" and "The 15 Pro Max weighs within 10% of the 14 Pro Max's weight". Myke believed that a 10% margin on either side is too wide to be risky and also that the AirPower one is just a better risky pick with less math. Once it's settled to go with the AirPower one, Federico asks to clarify "looks like" and the pick is modified to specify a lack of charging targets.

text: Apple announces a new display that is not the Pro XDR, launching by the end of 2021 somewhere
full-pick-text: Apple announces a new display that is not the Pro XDR, launching by the end of 2021 somewhere
notes:
• This was originally a pick about the Mac Pro being fully announced, but it was too close to Myke's risky pick.
  • The long-wished-for cheaper Apple display finally came out in 2022.

text: Apple announces an AI deal with Google
full-pick-text: Apple announces an AI deal with Google
notes: • Originally included the word "also" but that was confusing things.

text: Apple announces updates for Final Cut Pro and/or Logic for the iPad
full-pick-text: Apple announces updates for Final Cut Pro and/or Logic for the iPad
notes: • Was originally just "pro apps" but Federico wanted some clarification.

text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro...
full-pick-text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro. It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year.
notes:
• "...It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year."
  • Originally it said "same case design", but the change was accepted on air after Myke reconsidered. "Later this year" was also demoted from being an exact quote.
  • This Mac Pro will have to beat the Mac Studio in terms of ports: 2 USB-C, 2 USB-A, 4 Thunderbolt, SD card, Ethernet, HDMI, and headphone jack, for a total of 12.
  • This pick is similar in spirit to Myke's ongoing Annual pick, but with different conditions. At the time it was the most complex graded pick ever made.

text: Apple gives another extended free period of TV+ with new product purchases, even if you already had a trial
full-pick-text: Apple gives another extended free period of TV+ with new product purchases, even if you already had a trial
notes:
• The pick went through a little more revision after round 2 ended.
  • Apple extended the existing free period for TV+, which does not count
  • Myke notes that, since this extension was announced via press release before the event, a differently-worded pick may have been ambiguous based on the rules at the time, so an explicit rule about the scoring window is added.

text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
full-pick-text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
notes:
• "No Intel Macs are available for sale without an Apple Silicon counterpart." Myke points out the iMac Pro as a potential spoiler.
  • (For pick complexity purposes, I'm counting this as 1 condition for each Mac line that still had no Apple Silicon counterpart at the beginning of 2021: The larger MacBook Pros, the iMac in both sizes, the iMac Pro, and the Mac Pro. The Mac mini is 1 line with a high end and low end, so it already had an "Apple Silicon counterpart" although the high end Mac mini was still Intel.)
  • The iMac Pro left the lineup entirely, but the Mac Pro remained on Intel for about a year and a half more.

text: Apple introduces a faster chip for the iPhone
full-pick-text: Apple introduces a faster chip for the iPhone
notes:
• Was originally "The Pro iPhones increase in size" but Stephen argued that his round 2 pick pre-empted this one because he drafts first as the previous winner, and the first two rounds are "equal."
  • Ungraded, Myke thinks the chip name may include "AI".

text: Apple introduces a new, lower end Apple Watch model in addition to the higher end Series 6
full-pick-text: Apple introduces a new, lower end Apple Watch model in addition to the higher end Series 6

text: Apple introduces new "vegan leather" cases
full-pick-text: Apple introduces new "vegan leather" cases
notes: • Added late in the episode to go "from 7 to 11"... but that's only the beginning.

text: Apple launches at least one iPad model with a new display technology
full-pick-text: Apple launches at least one iPad model with a new display technology
notes: • He initially picked mini LED specifically. And after further discussion it was agreed that this meant a new display technology for the iPad, so for example OLED would also count.

text: Apple launches immersive video content using TV+ IP
full-pick-text: Apple launches immersive video content using TV+ IP
notes: • Stephen's original version of the pick was just about any immersive video, but that was already announced.

text: Apple Music Classical ships
full-pick-text: Apple Music Classical ships
notes: • Was originally written "Apple Music Classic", but Myke pointed out that it isn't called "classic music".

text: Apple previews a new visionOS feature that puts overlays over the camera passthrough with information about objects in view
full-pick-text: Apple previews a new visionOS feature that puts overlays over the camera passthrough with information about objects in view
notes: • Was originally "app" instead of "feature".

text: Apple redesigns the App Store app for Mac to include iOS, macOS, and iPadOS apps together
full-pick-text: Apple redesigns the App Store app for Mac to include iOS, macOS, and iPadOS apps together

text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
full-pick-text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
notes: • Was originally just "15 inch" but a specific range was requested after Federico's pick was read.

text: Apple shares a video touting the benefits of the time-of-flight sensor found in the 2020 iPad Pros for AR
full-pick-text: Apple shares a video touting the benefits of the time-of-flight sensor found in the 2020 iPad Pros for AR
notes: • He was talking about LIDAR, that's accepted. And Myke tracks down the video as well.

text: Apple ships an AR, VR, and/or MR dedicated device
full-pick-text: Apple ships an AR, VR, and/or MR dedicated device

text: Apple showcases at least one new feature coming in iOS or iPadOS 14.1
full-pick-text: Apple showcases at least one new feature coming in iOS or iPadOS 14.1
notes: • The version number wasn't stated explicitly, otherwise Fitness+ would have counted.

text: Apple teases another Mac, that is not for sale right now, with Pro in the name, and says that it is coming next year
full-pick-text: Apple teases another Mac, that is not for sale right now, with Pro in the name, and says that it is coming next year
notes: • It was originally "Mac product", but there was some controversy over whether that includes accessories and displays. Ultimately, Myke upped the difficulty and removed the word "product".

text: Apple TV app will receive a refreshed design
full-pick-text: Apple TV app will receive a refreshed design

text: Apple unveils a "Space Black" MacBook Pro
full-pick-text: Apple unveils a "Space Black" MacBook Pro

text: Apple unveils a new Apple Pencil
full-pick-text: Apple unveils a new Apple Pencil
notes:
• Ungraded: Support for gestures like squeezing and the inclusion of haptic feedback
  • Was originally about Apple introducing a new keyboard, but Federico already has an annual pick for that, and that makes it ineligible.

text: Apple unveils a new high-end audio product
full-pick-text: Apple unveils a new high-end audio product
notes:
• "As defined by a price of over $399, or it's a stand-alone DAC."
  • The idea of an official Apple DAC sparks a lot of discussion.

text: Apple Watch SE is updated and it's not made of aluminium
full-pick-text: Apple Watch SE is updated and it's not made of aluminium

text: Apple Watches get thinner
full-pick-text: Apple Watches get thinner

text: Apple will bring back some kind of "app list/launcher" UI element on iPad
full-pick-text: Apple will bring back some kind of "app list/launcher" UI element on iPad
notes:
• Federico cites parts of Slide Over's new multitasking interface, and when that doesn't seem to be working, says "If you don't give me this point, I will call the police." It escalates to the point of typing 911 into his phone.
  • "Some kind of" is vague enough to count this, and it definitely is not because of the threat.

text: Apple will launch its own podcast content beyond its existing deal with Oprah
full-pick-text: Apple will launch its own podcast content beyond its existing deal with Oprah

text: Apple will name a successor to Steve Dowling, former head of public relations at Apple
full-pick-text: Apple will name a successor to Steve Dowling, former head of public relations at Apple
notes:
• "Either named by Apple officially, or reported by more than one outlet that a person has been appointed."
  • Clearly in no hurry to do this, Apple finally hired Stella Low to the role in 2021.

text: Apple will not unveil additional details about the release of the first Apple Silicon Macs
full-pick-text: Apple will not unveil additional details about the release of the first Apple Silicon Macs
notes: • Myke challenged Stephen to make this a sixth Flexie in the discussion of his previous pick.

text: Apple will release a new monitor
full-pick-text: Apple will release a new monitor
notes: • Myke wanted an additional pick to match the 7 of the other hosts, so this was thrown in after the others had gone.

text: Apple's original content will premiere after the service itself launches
full-pick-text: Apple's original content will premiere after the service itself launches
notes: • "non original content will come first, excluding existing programs"

text: At least 1 iPhone gets a camera with a more than 3x zoom
full-pick-text: At least 1 iPhone gets a camera with a more than 3x zoom
notes: • Was "telephoto lens" specifically before Myke reconsidered

text: At least one iPhone gets a 120 hz refresh rate display
full-pick-text: At least one iPhone gets a 120 hz refresh rate display
notes: • This was nearly a reuse of a previous pick before the live chat caught it. The fix was to specify an exact refresh rate to make it more specific.

text: At least one iPhone will have the notch removed, replaced by a cut-out(s) for the camera and sensors, free-floating from the border
full-pick-text: At least one iPhone will have the notch removed, replaced by a cut-out(s) for the camera and sensors, free-floating from the border
notes: • Or, as Stephen so poetically put it, "AKA an island of black glass in an ocean of pixels." Little did he know that Apple would actually call it "the Dynamic Island".

text: At least one new MacBook Pro model has an upgraded webcam with a higher resolution
full-pick-text: At least one new MacBook Pro model has an upgraded webcam with a higher resolution
notes: • Must be better than the current 720p. Ungraded, Federico expects a 1080p camera.

text: At least one new non-Pro iPad will switch to USB-C
full-pick-text: At least one new non-Pro iPad will switch to USB-C

text: At least one of the new iPhones will support the new Qi 2 wireless charging standard...
full-pick-text: At least one of the new iPhones will support the new Qi 2 wireless charging standard, and "reverse wireless charging" for AirPods cases. MagSafe charging speed will also be raised from 15 watts
notes:
• "... and "reverse wireless charging" for AirPods cases. MagSafe charging speed will also be raised from 15 watts."
  • Originally didn't include the last sentence.
  • The previous rumors of reverse wireless charging didn't disqualify this pick since it's in combination with Qi 2 as well. It's pointed out that Qi 2 is basically just standardized MagSafe as well, but it's still allowed as they'll have to be specific about Qi 2 to count it. Stephen still thinks it lacks passion. Later, Federico sprinkled some passion on it after all by adding a charging wattage increase after all.

text: At least one of the new non-Pro iPads will have an iPad Pro inspired design
full-pick-text: At least one of the new non-Pro iPads will have an iPad Pro inspired design
notes: • "(the flat sides are key)"

text: Big Sur gets a revised release window
full-pick-text: Big Sur gets a revised release window

text: Craig Federighi is stranded somewhere
full-pick-text: Craig Federighi is stranded somewhere

text: Craig travels from one set to another in a ridiculous fashion
full-pick-text: Craig travels from one set to another in a ridiculous fashion

text: Craig wears a costume for some portion of the event
full-pick-text: Craig wears a costume for some portion of the event

text: Federico considers implanting a magnet and/or NFC chip into his body
full-pick-text: Federico considers implanting a magnet and/or NFC chip into his body
notes: • Added on the fly during recording.

text: iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
full-pick-text: iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
notes:
• Also, "Apple will let users choose their own app icons, and they'll introduce new App Store categories for wallpaper and/or icon apps"
  • A reuse and double down of last year's Flexie.

text: iOS 18.1 announced to ship in "October"
full-pick-text: iOS 18.1 announced to ship in "October"

text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once (reuse)
full-pick-text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once (reuse)
notes:
• Was originally "The Lightning port on the iPhone 14 Pro is upgraded to at least USB 3.0", but it turns out this has been rumored. This prompts a rule change. Stephen thought of a few options which became Flexies, but ultimately opts to reuse Federico's Risky pick from the last game, word for word (a legal choice under the Bill).
  • Federico, oddly, argues for this being correct, with the Dynamic Island allowing multiple app use. But the others agree that, while funny, that isn't it.

text: iOS gets the ability to change default apps from those that Apple make, including email
full-pick-text: iOS gets the ability to change default apps from those that Apple make, including email

text: iPad Virtual Display announced for visionOS
full-pick-text: iPad Virtual Display announced for visionOS

full-pick-text: iPadOS 15 brings organization changes to the home screen that don't exist on the iPhone, including iOS 15
notes:
• "Widgets on home screen and App Library don't count as they are on the iPhone already"
  • This was originally a Risky Pick, but Myke couldn't get enough clarity for what it meant.

full-pick-text: iPadOS 17 AI enhancements for iPad only
notes: • Was originally "iOS" but Federico is a stickler for the Apple style guide.

text: iPhone 15 gets slower-speed USB-C transfers compared to the Pro models
full-pick-text: iPhone 15 gets slower-speed USB-C transfers compared to the Pro models
notes: • "Compared to the Pro models" was added for clarity.

text: Jeff Williams has a major role in introducing the headset
full-pick-text: Jeff Williams has a major role in introducing the headset
notes: • Was originally Kevin Lynch until Myke, ever the sportsman, pointed out that Lynch is supposedly on the car project, not the headset.

text: Jeff Williams is seen in nature
full-pick-text: Jeff Williams is seen in nature

text: Legacy widgets are completely removed from the system, and there is no longer a place to put widgets to the left of the main home screen
full-pick-text: Legacy widgets are completely removed from the system, and there is no longer a place to put widgets to the left of the main home screen
notes: • Legacy widgets finally met their end at WWDC 2024, but the space for new-fashioned widgets remained.

text: MagSafe is updated to support 20 watt charging or higher, but a new puck is required
full-pick-text: MagSafe is updated to support 20 watt charging or higher, but a new puck is required
notes: • This was originally just "faster charging", but the live chat pointed out a recent FCC filing by Apple which undercut the riskiness of the pick. Stephen added a specific wattage target and also had to decide whether the existing MagSafe puck will support the higher wattage.

text: New AirPods Max
full-pick-text: New AirPods Max
notes: • Was originally "AirPods Max 2"

text: New AirPods or AirPods Pro
full-pick-text: New AirPods or AirPods Pro
notes: • Not until October 18, 2021.

full-pick-text: New colours in the iPhone line as compared to the previous year

text: No Apple-made headset is seen
full-pick-text: No Apple-made headset is seen
notes: • Was originally "AR/VR/MR hardware" and "introduced", but the others wanted some clarifications.

text: No Mac or iPad hardware in the keynote
full-pick-text: No Mac or iPad hardware in the keynote
notes: • 10.2" iPad was announced

text: No Macs and iPads at this event
full-pick-text: No Macs and iPads at this event

text: No new Mac announced will have a touchscreen
full-pick-text: No new Mac announced will have a touchscreen

text: No preview of AR/VR/MR-focused hardware
full-pick-text: No preview of AR/VR/MR-focused hardware

text: No service bundle announced
full-pick-text: No service bundle announced
notes:
• "including any service being free with another, or some sort of content being added to the iPhone upgrade program"
  • Apple TV+ was announced as a free trial, but not as a bundle. And it doesn't really come with the upgrade program as such. Stephen threads the needle with this pick.

text: One of the new iPhones with LIDAR has a new portrait feature thanks to new sensors
full-pick-text: One of the new iPhones with LIDAR has a new portrait feature thanks to new sensors

full-pick-text: Only the big iPad Pro gets the new display technology

full-pick-text: Reminders gets a major update
notes:
• "(how do we decide major? on stage at WWDC or we decide past that)"
  • Ungraded: "some features that Federico would like to see", the actual features that Federico talked about were not recorded in the document, but were: a new, more flexible design, easier and faster to add dates and notes, tags, saved searches, better Files integration

text: Second-generation AirPods Max will ship during the year
full-pick-text: Second-generation AirPods Max will ship during the year
notes: • Was originally "AirPods Max 2" specifically.

text: Some new iOS 18 features will be exclusive to the iPhone 15 Pro line
full-pick-text: Some new iOS 18 features will be exclusive to the iPhone 15 Pro line
notes: • Was originally just "iPhone 15 line" but it was pointed out that the plain 15 phones have the same processor as the 14 Pro.

text: Something in the default Dock of Catalina becomes a Catalyst app
full-pick-text: Something in the default Dock of Catalina becomes a Catalyst app

text: The 11" iPad Pro gets a mini LED display
full-pick-text: The 11" iPad Pro gets a mini LED display
notes: • This was originally "WWDC 2022 will be virtual", but that was very close to last year's pick, which was within the 365 day limit. It was a borderline judgement, but ultimately they decided they didn't like the precedent.

text: The Apple Watch segment is presented in and around a gym
full-pick-text: The Apple Watch segment is presented in and around a gym

text: The big iPad Pro is updated with a feature that is unique to it
full-pick-text: The big iPad Pro is updated with a feature that is unique to it

full-pick-text: The brown iPhone Pro does not have "gold" in its name

full-pick-text: The HomePod will gain multiple user support via voice detection

text: The iPad mini does receive the new design language
full-pick-text: The iPad mini does receive the new design language
notes: • "Originally, Stephen said it would not receive it", but the other hosts criticized him for his negativity.

text: The iPad mini will be updated with a new design inspired by the iPad Pro's design
full-pick-text: The iPad mini will be updated with a new design inspired by the iPad Pro's design
notes: • Stephen was almost exactly one year too early, as this would finally come true in 2021.

text: The iPad Pro line is updated before the iPhone with a hardware feature that's not on any current iPhone in 2019 or 2020
full-pick-text: The iPad Pro line is updated before the iPhone with a hardware feature that's not on any current iPhone in 2019 or 2020
notes: • Myke says during grading that he originally expected 5G to get him this point but LIDAR did instead, but he actually focused on LIDAR when originally explaining this pick. (During the grading, Federico delivers his impromptu review of the 2020 iPad Pro.)

text: The iPad's external display support goes unchanged
full-pick-text: The iPad's external display support goes unchanged
notes:
• Was originally "By December 31, 2022, no Intel Macs will remain on sale as new machines", but this was also too close for comfort, although arguably the previous pick was more permissive than this would have been.
  • Stage Manager in fact brought major changes.

text: The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality
full-pick-text: The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality

text: The iPhone Pro comes with color-matched cables
full-pick-text: The iPhone Pro comes with color-matched cables

text: The keyboard for iPad Pro is substantially redesigned for the first time since its introduction in 2020
full-pick-text: The keyboard for iPad Pro is substantially redesigned for the first time since its introduction in 2020
notes:
• Federico's cohosts generously helped workshop some of the possible nitpicks out of the pick.
  • Ungraded: "function row, backlight, material change, multiple USB ports, different viewing angles"

text: The Mac Pro will ship (in 2019 this time)
full-pick-text: The Mac Pro will ship (in 2019 this time)
notes:
• Added mid-year: Must be able to order a Mac Pro by the end of 2019, they do not have to arrive in customer hands by the end of the year.
  • Ungraded: "I waffle on sticking with my iMac Pro"; he bought one almost immediately. Myke predicted that Stephen would buy a Mac Pro, exchange it for an iMac Pro, then buy another Mac Pro in 6 months.

text: The names of the colours of the iMac are unchanged
full-pick-text: The names of the colours of the iMac are unchanged
notes: • Cleverly worded so that if the iMac isn't touched, the pick is still correct, but Federico's questioning of whether a change in hue counts causes Myke to water it down to just names. At the time of the pick, the colors were "Blue, Green, Pink, Silver, Yellow, Orange, Purple".

text: The new Apple Pencil is named Apple Pencil Pro
full-pick-text: The new Apple Pencil is named Apple Pencil Pro

text: The new Apple Silicon MacBook Pro will not be announced at this event
full-pick-text: The new Apple Silicon MacBook Pro will not be announced at this event
notes: • This was originally going to be "No Macs", but at this point everyone was on the lookout for reused picks and this one has come up a few times.

text: The new Apple Watch SE costs $199
full-pick-text: The new Apple Watch SE costs $199
notes: • Stephen is pressured into adding more, you know, for the kids.

text: The new iPhone color is called Earth Titanium
full-pick-text: The new iPhone color is called Earth Titanium

text: The new iPhones will carry a new design inspired by the iPad Pro/iPhone 4
full-pick-text: The new iPhones will carry a new design inspired by the iPad Pro/iPhone 4
notes: • "Flat sides"

text: The new Mac mini comes in more colors than silver and grey
full-pick-text: The new Mac mini comes in more colors than silver and grey
notes: • Was originally "in multiple colors".

text: The new Mac Pro will be...
full-pick-text: The new Mac Pro will be smaller, not a cube shape, feature no support for the current MPX modules and/or will allow for some form of expandability outside of Thunderbolt. It will be only be available in one color.
notes:
• "... smaller, not a cube shape, feature no support for the current MPX modules and/or will allow for some form of expandability outside of Thunderbolt. It will be only be available in one color."
  • Another "and/or" added to a pick, which happened a few times this episode. It applies to just the MPX modules and expandability clause.

text: The notch on the iPhone will get physically smaller in at least one of the 2020 iPhones
full-pick-text: The notch on the iPhone will get physically smaller in at least one of the 2020 iPhones
notes: • Grading for this was tricky, but Stephen discovered that the Apple Accessory Design Guidelines indicate that the notch got very slightly smaller, by millimeters, mostly due to the switch from LCD to OLED in the iPhone 12. The consensus is that it's a technical victory but not an honorable one.

text: The Pro iPhone gets a new camera feature the regular iPhone doesn't get
full-pick-text: The Pro iPhone gets a new camera feature the regular iPhone doesn't get

text: The regular Apple Watch models each get larger screens and cases
full-pick-text: The regular Apple Watch models each get larger screens and cases

text: The removal of Force Touch on watchOS is framed as the inclusion of Haptic Touch
full-pick-text: The removal of Force Touch on watchOS is framed as the inclusion of Haptic Touch

text: The visual design of the 14" and 16" MacBook Pro is unchanged
full-pick-text: The visual design of the 14" and 16" MacBook Pro is unchanged
notes: • The word "visual" was added, but it's agreed that we'll know it when we see it.

text: The Wallet app gets a new design
full-pick-text: The Wallet app gets a new design
notes: • Apparently left unfinished in the document, this was originally just "The Wallet app."

text: There are new AirPods Max, but they don't fold
full-pick-text: There are new AirPods Max, but they don't fold

text: There are new ways to turn off the alerts that Shortcuts displays constantly
full-pick-text: There are new ways to turn off the alerts that Shortcuts displays constantly
notes:
• "Either confirmation banners or the notification when running with automation."
  • This came with iOS 16, and the Dynamic Island changed some of these interactions as well.

text: There is going to be a funny scene involving one of the characters of Ted Lasso
full-pick-text: There is going to be a funny scene involving one of the characters of Ted Lasso
notes: • Federico originally had "Universal Control has been postponed to a future macOS Monterey update", but during the show a new macOS beta was released with the feature not available, but at least mentioned in an unselectable check box.

text: There is no new hardware announced or released
full-pick-text: There is no new hardware announced or released
notes:
• Was just "announced" but Stephen actually made it riskier to better fit his intent with the pick.
  • An announcement about Vision Pro in more countries doesn't make this wrong.

text: There will be a chip named M1 followed by a letter
full-pick-text: There will be a chip named M1 followed by a letter

text: There will be a setting to disable the higher refresh rate in at least one of the new iPhones
full-pick-text: There will be a setting to disable the higher refresh rate in at least one of the new iPhones
notes:
• Was originally just a pick about a new, as-yet-unannounced iOS 15 feature, but the hosts suspected that was another reuse.
  • In retrospect, this was a tricky pick to grade because how would we know the day after the event? Federico provides some insider information indicating that the setting does exist, but can it be said to have "come true", as the rule states, without proof? The meaning of truth itself is debated, perhaps a philosophical high point for the Rickies. The point is ultimately granted, with the understanding that in the future, the rules will be amended to clarify that picks must be publicly verifiable to earn points.
